tasks.task: Attend a webinar on growing lentils and note key points.
subtasks: Sit or stand while watching the webinar.
Keep microphones muted to avoid background noise.
Answer survey questions about experience with lentil growing and region.
Take notes on agronomy updates for 2019 (Jason Brand).
Listen to research update on managing ryegrass resistance in lentil rotations (Navneet Agarwal).
Retain information about new herbicide options (Ultro) for ryegrass control.
Recall disease management strategies (Jason Brand).
Understand market trends for lentils (Janine Saunet).
Stay updated on global pulse market fluctuations.
Note potential strategies for seed supply and variety selection (Jason Brand).
Consider storage and market timing for lentils.

tasks.task: Participate in a question and answer session about lentil production.
subtasks: Raise hand or use designated function to submit questions during the webinar.
Review presenters' contact information for further inquiries.
Check GRDC website for recordings and future webinar topics.

subtasks: Sit or stand during the webinar

tasks.task: Attend the webinar on growing lentils in 2019.
Gather information on lentil crop management.
subtasks: Note pivot points on ryegrass resistance.
Review new herbicide options and applications.
Note disease control strategies.
Select appropriate varieties based on disease pressure and location.

tasks.task: Attend a webinar on lentil production and note key recommendations.
MAINTASK: before every task. But maybe assume that the task should start with MAINTASK followed by an imperative. So proceeding accordingly.
Attend the Growing Lentils in 2019 webinar.
subtasks: Keep your microphone muted throughout the session.
Answer the survey questions about your experience with lentil growing and your location.
Take detailed notes on the recommendations for 2019 (e.g., ryegrass management, new herbicide options, disease control, variety selection, market trends).
Reflect on the key points from the Herbicide Management presentation (Ryegrass resistance, using group D and J chemicals, new herbicides like Ultro).
Note the variety options and their traits (PVA Hallmark, disease resistance, suitable varieties for different regions).
Stay informed about market trends and pricing by noting expert insights from Janine Saunet.
Prepare for upcoming planting season by taking notes on soil preparation, planting rates, and pre-emergent herbicide application (mention of use of group D and J chemicals).

tasks.task: Attend the webinar on growing lentils and note key agronomic, management, and market advice.
Participate in a webinar on lentil production.
Review the webinar content on lentil production.
subtasks: Note the role of ryegrass in causing yield loss and resistance development.
Note the importance of rotating herbicides to prevent resistance build-up.
Record the efficacy of new herbicides (e.g., Ultro) compared to traditional ones (propizamide, Boxer Gold, Seura).

tasks.task: Synthesize information on variety selection for 2019.
subtasks: Identify lines with improved vigor (e.g., PVA Hallmark, higher frost tolerance).
Note disease resistance profiles of recommended varieties (e.g., full resistance to Petri F2).

tasks.task: Consider market factors and storage.
subtasks: Note downward market trends and potential market constraints.

tasks.task: Attend the Growing Lentils in 2019 webinar.

Attend the Growing Lentils in 2019 webinar.
subtasks: Sit or stand during the session.
Mute your microphone to avoid technical interference (if required).
Answer surveys about your experience and location.
Take notes on the agronomy and management aspects discussed.

tasks.task: Derive actionable steps from the Growing Lentils in 2019 webinar.
subtasks: Recognize the evolving resistances in ryegrass and adjust herbicide rotation.
Evaluate the performance of new herbicides on ryegrass in lentil crops.
Prioritize group D propizamide in break crop phases.
Consider the importance of group J and K chemicals and avoid over-reliance.
Select disease-resistant varieties, such as PVA Hallmark, known for botrytis gray mold resistance.

tasks.task: Engage in a webinar on lentil cultivation.
subtasks: Remain seated or standing comfortably.
Engage mute/unmute feature as instructed.
Complete initial survey with truthful responses.
Actively participate in note-taking throughout the presentation.

tasks.task: Internalize the lentil production advice presented in the webinar.
subtasks: Physically adjust posture (sit/stand) to maintain attention.
Manipulate devices to turn microphones on/off as instructed.
Engage in typing responses to the survey questions.
Write notes in a physical notebook or use a digital device to take notes.

tasks.task: Process information from a lentil production webinar.
subtasks: Note the role of herbicides in ryegrass resistance (mentally or written).
Write down the modes of action for new herbicides (e.g., group D).
Trace the selection pressure leading to multiple resistance in ryegrass (mental).

tasks.task: Rotate herbicides in lentil crops based on research findings.
subtasks: Apply group D and J herbicides alternately to reduce resistance in ryegrass.

tasks.task: Note new herbicide options for ryegrass management.
subtasks: Identify Ultro (carbetamide) as effective and its potential for use in 2020.
